description: Erection of a two storey side and rear extension
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The facing materials to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates shall match those of the existing building.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The window at first floor level in the east (flank) elevation shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut to a height of 1.7m above finished floor level and shall be permanently retained as such thereafter.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
Please advise which submission to be processed as we have received 2 submissions (one on 23/07/2019 and the second on 24/07/2019). Please confirm which one is the correct one to be processed.
The fee required for your planning application is 11111  If payment is by cheque please make payable to Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames or via the Contact Centre on 0208 547 5002.
Condition 8 (Landscaping)Council's Neighbourhood Traffic Engineer requests the specification and makeup of the porous paving to be used.

Condition 10 (Cycle Parking)The Council's Neighbourhood Traffic Engineer considers that there has been insufficient information submitted to discharge this condition. The London Plan 2015 minimum requirement is two cycle parking spaces for a new unit, and the proposal should be in accordance with the Sustainable Transport SPD. The Council would require details of where the cycle parking will be located, and to demonstrate on a plan that there will be accommodation for a minimum of 2 cycle parking spaces.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:Minor repeat works with no detrimental impact upon the tree's health or public amenity.Recommendation:Approve.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The tree in question is an old pollard Lime which is not in excellent health and has been causing damage to drains, walls and hard surfacing for a long time. The tree is not worthy of a TPO according to the tests and as such I recommend a decsion of no objection.Recommendation:No objection.
Please confirm boundary distances for new windows/door (unprotected areas) to flank wall with reference to requirement B4 fire spread across the boundary. (B4)
Evidence of specified roof tiles being suitable for 15deg roof pitch (C2)
